CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, pg. 29, reads: "Police to Rescue - Russell James, 61, of 84 Fountain St., North Side, is being escorted to North Side Police Station ambulance by members of the ambulance crew, Patrolmen John Taylor and George Burchlaw.  James had been lying across the trolley tracks on Federal St. in the rain after being hit by an auto.  He was taken to Allegheny General Hospital and treated for a laceration of the left side of the face. - Harris Photo."The ambulance has a AAA bumper sticker "School's Open Drive Carefully."
TitMainTitle: Police officers John Taylor and George Burchlaw escorting injured Russell James to ambulance, North Side
